channel.title: Meta on ToastIT
channel.description: Recent content in Meta on ToastIT

item.title: My Learning Story: From Timber to Chocolatey
item.description: This post is part of #TheMVPChallenge. It’s not exactly what was on the brief… but I think it’s a story worth telling!

item.title: I'm Josh King, Sysadmin, and This Is How I Work (During Lockdown)
item.description: My last “How I Work” post was over three years ago and I’ve been considering an update for a while. What better time to do that than during the COVID-19 lockdown?

item.title: New Year's Resolutions - 2020
item.description: Apparently I forgot to do one of these posts last year. I like having these posts to look back on, so let’s get back on track!

item.title: Roll Your Sleeves Up, It's Hacktoberfest Time!
item.description: I’m gearing up for my fourth Hacktoberfest event, and so should you. You could even come away from this month with a fancy new t-shirt!

item.title: MVP: OMG
item.description: Today I’m humbled, shocked, and proud to announce that I’m now a Microsoft MVP.

item.title: A Toast to 2018
item.description: The community, in and of itself, made 2018 for me. If you haven’t already gotten engaged in it… put it on your list for 2019. You wont regret it.

item.title: I Need You! #Hacktoberfest
item.description: This is my third Hacktoberfest, the event that made October one of my favorite months of the year!

item.title: Echo, Echo: Combine System Sounds with your Microphone for Skype for Business Presentations
item.description: I don’t know if this will help anyone else, and it’s more for future me, but I hope it helps someone out there!

item.title: How to TechSnips
item.description: On the fence about becoming a TechSnips contributor? Here’s some of my tips… hopefully they will help you hit record!

item.title: Coding with Kids Doesn't "Bug" Me!
item.description: One day my daughter will be putting my code to shame, and I can’t wait.

item.title: A Graphical Example of the Value of Planet PowerShell
item.description: If you have a PowerShell blog, I can’t overstate how valuable it is to get your feed hooked up to Planet PowerShell!

item.title: Automatic Blog Archive Tweets
item.description: This morning I was up at 4 AM, live streaming the creation of an auto-tweet script.

item.title: Blog Makeover - Why, Where, How?
item.description: Didn’t I literally just post about my blogging workflow on GitHub Pages? Welp, I’m not there anymore!

item.title: Get the (Tech)Snip!
item.description: TechSnips is a new e-learning service and I’ve been recording content for it, along with many other contributors.

item.title: My Blogging Workflow
item.description: I’ve also noticed a number of people saying ‘I want to get into it… but need to figure out x and y first.

item.title: A Quick Look Back at #PSHSummit 2018
item.description: After another three flights, and 16 hours in the air, I’m back home in New Zealand. I can certainly say that the change in time zones has hit me harder coming back. Going over to Bellevue, I got right into things and felt (for the most part) normal. Last week I did a blog post for each day of the PowerShell + DevOps Global Summit , going over what I took part in that day and what my main takeaways were.

item.title: Day Four of #PSHSummit 2018 - Iron Scripter
item.description: That’s it. It’s over. I’ve shaken many hand, met many people, and seen lots of PowerShell.

item.title: Day Three of #PSHSummit 2018 - I Did the Thing
item.description: Today was the reason I was able to be here at Summit. Today was the day I presented in front of about 100 people.

item.title: Day Two of #PSHSummit 2018 - Getting Smart
item.description: No comments about the plumbing or anything today, having gotten over the initial shock.

item.title: Day One of #PSHSummit 2018 - Bright-Eyed and Bushy-Tailed
item.description: Why the hell are American toilets so full?

item.title: Where the bloody hell are ya?
item.description: This seems like a decent excuse for a ‘State of the Blog’ post.

item.title: New Year's Resolutions - 2018
item.description: Woah, 2017 flew by.

item.title: #PSBlogWeek 2017 Recap
item.description: It was a great event, with five days worth of awesome PowerShell content coming out!

item.title: October: The Hackiest Month of the Year
item.description: Summits, Blogging, and Hacking make October the ‘hackiest’ month of the year.

item.title: The War on Passwords
item.description: The NIST guidelines struck a chord with me. It seemed to be something that our users would embrace while addressing potential issues within any given workplace

item.title: Old Office 365 Training: Navigating the Minefield
item.description: At first, I figured this wouldn’t cause me much of an issue. Information is information right?

item.title: New Year’s Resolutions - 2017
item.description: New Year’s Resolutions are the in thing, right?

item.title: I'm Josh King, 'IT Pro,' and This Is How I Work
item.description: Consider this my ‘How I Work’ post, and if you’re interested in reading more posts from other bloggers make sure you check out the list of participants on GitHub
